meanings.definition: Understand or comprehend (a difficult problem or an enigmatic person) after much thought.
meanings.sent1: After studying hard, I finally fathom the math problem.
meanings.sent2: It took me a while to fathom the mystery novel's ending.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't fathom why the chicken crossed the road, so I asked it.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a puzzle, but I managed to fathom their true meaning.
meanings.sent5: With patience, I was able to fathom the complex instructions.

meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to six feet (approximately 1.8 meters), chiefly used in reference to the depth of water.
meanings.sent1: The diver could not fathom the depth of the ocean below.
meanings.sent2: The ship's captain needed to fathom the water's depth before docking.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman's tale of a fathom-long fish seemed unbelievable.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the cave seemed to fathom the unknown depths within.
meanings.sent5: The sailor's map helped him fathom the sea's measurements accurately.
